Mesh (Base)¶

class mimpy.mesh.mesh.Mesh[source]¶

The Mesh class is a common representation of polygonal meshes in Mimpy. In addition to the mesh data structure, it provides commonly used mesh functions as such calculating volumes and centroids as well as basic visualization. The Mesh class serves as base implementation, with the specific mesh types (such as hexahedra, tetrahedra and Voronoi) inherting from it.

add_boundary_face(boundary_marker, face_index, face_orientation)[source]¶

Assign face_index to a certain boundary_marker grouping. the face_orientation indicates whether the normal of that face points in (-1) or out (1) of the cell the face belongs to.

A face should never be associated with more than one marker.

Parameters:
  • boundary_marker (int) – Boundary marker index.
  • face_index (int) – Index of face.
  • face_orientation (int) – Orientation of face normal relative to the domain. (1) if pointing out, (-1) if if pointing in.
Returns:

None
add_boundary_marker(boundary_marker, boundary_description)[source]¶

Add a new boundary marker.

Parameters:
  • boundary_marker (int) – New boundary marker index.
  • boundary_description (str) – Text describing the boundary marker.
add_cell(list_of_faces, list_of_orientations)[source]¶

Adds a new cell to the mesh. A cell is represented by a list of face indices. The function also takes in a list of orientations of the same length as the list_of_faces. These represent the direction of the face normals relative to the cell: (1) points in, (-1) points out. Returns the index of the new cell.

Parameters:
  • list_of_faces (list) – List of face indices making up new cell.
  • list_of_orientations (list) – List consisting of 1s and -1s indicating whether normals are pointing out (1) or in (-1) of cell.
Returns:

New cell index.
Return type:

int
add_face(list_of_points)[source]¶

Takes a list of point indices, and appends them to the list of faces in the mesh. The point indices must be oriented in a clockwise direction relative to the face normal. In 2D, a face is represnted by two points. Returns the index of the new face.

Parameters:list_of_points (list) – List of point indices making up the new face.
Returns:Index of new face.
Return type:int
add_internal_no_flow(face_index, face_orientation)[source]¶

Sets face as interior no flow boundary condition.

Parameters:
  • face_index (int) – Face index to be set as internal no-flow.
  • face_orientation (int) – Orientation of face relative to the domain, (1) for pointing out, (-1) for pointing in.
add_point(new_point)[source]¶

Takes a Numpy array representing the cartesian point coodrinates, and appends the point to the end of the point list. Returns the index of the new point.

Parameters:new_point (ndarray) – New point to be added to mesh.
Returns:Index of new point.
Return type:int
add_to_face_to_cell(face_index, cell_index)[source]¶

Adds cell_index to face_to_cell map at face_index.

Parameters:
  • face_index (int) – The face index.
  • cell_index (int) – The cell index that will be associated with the face.
build_frac_from_faces(faces, width=0.0001)[source]¶

Takes a list of face indices, and extrudes them into cells.

build_mesh()[source]¶

Base class function for constructing the mesh.

compute_polygon_area(polygon, dims=[0, 1])[source]¶

Computes the area of a polygon. A polygon is represented by a list of Numpy array coordinates going around the polygon. The optional parameter dims represents which two coordinates to use when the polygon is in 3D space.

construct_polygon_from_segs(segments)[source]¶

Takes point pairs and constructs a single polygon from joining all the ends. The pairs are identified by directly comparing the point locations.

create_new_boundary_marker(boundary_description)[source]¶

Creates new boundary marker and assures that the index is unique. Returns the index of the new boundary marker.

divide_cell_by_plane(cell_index, point_on_plane, plane_normal)[source]¶

Divides given cell into two cells based on a plane specified by a point on the plane and the plane normal.

duplicate_face(face_index)[source]¶

Creates new face with all the properties of the face_index, and adds the face to the bottom of the face list. The function returns the new face index.

Parameters:face_index (int) – Face index to be duplicated.
Returns:Face index of new duplicated face.
Return type:int
find_basis_for_face(face_index)[source]¶

Finds two non collinear vectors in face to serve as basis for plane.

find_boundary_marker(face_index, markers)[source]¶

Returns the boundary marker containing face_index.

find_cell_near_point(point, condition=<function <lambda>>)[source]¶

Returns cell whose centroid is closest to a given point. Condition is an optional function to avoid cells with certain conditions (e.g. too small). Condition takes in cell_index.

find_centroid_for_coordinates(face_index, coordinates)[source]¶

Computes centroid calculation for a 3D polygon based on two coordinates of the polygon.

find_domain_faces(domain)[source]¶

Identifies the faces on the boundary of the domain.

find_face_centroid(face_index)[source]¶

Returns centroid coordinates for face_index. This function assumes planarity of the face. and is currently intended for use with three dimensional meshes. The function returns the area of the face, as well as the x, y, z coordinates of its center.

find_face_normal(face_index)[source]¶

Finds the face normal based on rotation around the face boundary. Assumes the face is planar.

find_volume_centroid(cell_index)[source]¶

Returns the volume and centroid for a 3D cell_index. Based on code and paper by Brian Mirtich.

find_volume_centroid_all()[source]¶

Computes the cell centroids and volumes for all the cells in the mesh.

find_volume_from_faces(face_list, orientation_list)[source]¶

Calculates volume and centroid of cell based on list of faces and face orientations relative to the cell.

get_cell_normal_orientation(cell_index)[source]¶

Given a cell index, returns a list of face orientations for that cell.

Parameters:cell_index (int) – Index of cell.
Returns:List of faces orientations in cell. The list is made up of 1s and -1s, 1 if the corresponding face normal is pointing out of the cell, and -1 if the corresponding face normal is pointing into the cell.
Return type:list

Parameters:intput_file (file) – Mesh file (mms).
Returns:None
output_cell_normals(file_name, cell_index)[source]¶

Outputs the normals over the cell in the outward direction. The function is intended for checking the correct orientation of cell.

output_vector_field(file_name, vector_magnitudes=[], vector_labels=[])[source]¶

Outputs vector data in the vtk format. The vector field can be processed using the glyph filter in Paraview. The function takes a list of vector magnitudes that are associated with each face normal.

output_vtk_faces(file_name, face_indices, face_values=[], face_value_labels=[])[source]¶

Outputs in vtk format the faces in face_indices.

output_vtk_mesh(file_name, cell_values=[], cell_value_labels=[])[source]¶

Base implementation for producing vtk files for general polyhedral meshes.

None
set_boundary_markers(boundary_markers, boundary_descriptions)[source]¶

Initialize the mesh boundary labeling. Each marker can represent a single boundary face or a group of faces.

boundary_markers: List of integers. boundary_descriptions: List of strings describing the face groups.

set_dirichlet_face_pointer(face_index, face_orientation, cell_index)[source]¶

Sets the value of a Dirichlet boundary to value of cell pressure for cell_index. This approach is used for coupling fractures with a reservoir.

set_face(face_index, points)[source]¶

Sets a new set of points for a given face_index.

Parameters:
  • face_index (int) – Face index of face to be set.
  • points (list) – New list of points making up face.
Returns:

None
set_face_area(face_index, area)[source]¶

Sets face area (float) for face_index.

set_face_normal(face_index, normal)[source]¶

Set face normal (array) to face_index.

set_face_real_centroid(face_index, centroid)[source]¶

Sets face centroid for face_index.

set_face_shifted_centroid(face_index, centroid)[source]¶

Sets face shifted centroid.

set_face_to_lagrange_pointer(face_index, face_orientation, lagrange_index)[source]¶

Sets face to dirichlet type boundary pointing to lagrange multiplier.

set_forcing_pointer(cell_index, face_indices, face_orientations)[source]¶

Sets the value of the forcing function implicity as the sum of the fluxes from list of faces. This approach is used for coupling fractures with a reservoir.

set_gravity_vector(gravity_vector)[source]¶

Set vector indicating gravity acceleration direction.

set_lagrange_to_face_pointers(lagrange_index, face_index, orientation)[source]¶

Sets the lagrange multiplier to the source faces in order to impose zero flux across the boundary.

set_periodic_boundary(face_index_1, face_orientation_1, face_index_2, face_orientation_2)[source]¶

Sets a periodic boundary condition, connecting face 1 with face 2. This ammounts to creating a single lagrange multiplier shared by the faces. The MFD class would impose continuity of both the pressure and the flux for the periodic conditions.

subdivide_by_domain(cells)[source]¶

Takes a collection of cells, and seperates them from the rest of the domain using lagrange multipliers at the sub-domain boundary.

use_alpha()[source]¶

Activates the ability to set the alpha parameter for each cell.

use_cell_shifted_centroid()[source]¶

Sets whether a shifted cell centroid will be used for mesh.

use_face_shifted_centroid()[source]¶

Sets whether a shifted face centroid will be used for mesh.
